intro: Phlomoides younghushandii, commonly known as the Namib Desert phlomis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and gray-green foliage adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers during the rainy season, typically in late winter to early spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access deep water sources in the sandy soils of its habitat. This species plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing limited forage for local wildlife.
